'''Gabite''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese:]] '''ガバイト''' ''Gabite'') is a dual-type {{2t|Dragon|Ground}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Gible}} starting at [[level]] 24 and evolves into {{p|Garchomp}} starting at level 48.

==Biology==
Gabite is a medium-sized, bipedal dragon-like Pokémon that is primarily blue. Its underside is light blue, with red covering it from the middle of its abdomens to the bottoms of its jaw. Gabite has two appendages that resemble {{wp|jet}}s or {{wp|plane}} engines extending out the side of its skull. Each appendage has a blue stripe. It has four fins, one on each arm, one on its back and another on its tail. The back fin has a notch on it for the male. It has spikes on its hind limbs, and sharp claws on its feet. Its eyes have black {{wp|sclera}}s and {{wp|gold (color)|gold}} colored {{wp|Iris (anatomy)|irises}}.

Gabite is a fierce and predatory Pokémon, known for its scales, of which have medicinal properties and can heal most [[Status condition|illnesses]]. Gabite has short, extremely sharp teeth, like its pre-evolution, Gible. It has been known to move at {{stat|speed|extreme speeds}}. Gabite is also a very territorial creature, and will fight back against enemies to protect its home. Gabite has a habit of digging up gems and hoarding them in its nest.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ursula Gabite.png|thumb|left|250px|Gabite in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ursula's Gabite]]====
[[Pokémon Coordinator]] [[Ursula]] owns a Gabite, which debuted in ''[[DP114|Another One Gabites the Dust!]]''. Gabite is Ursula's main Pokémon and has been used in several [[Contest Battle]]s.

====Other====
Gabite debuted in ''[[SS020|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time & Darkness]]''. It was sick of others wanting to get its scales so it wants a fight in exchange for one now.

===Minor appearances===
A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Gabite appeared in ''[[DP182|An Old Family Blend!]]''.

A Gabite appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]''.

[[Professor Sycamore]]'s Garchomp was shown as a Gabite in a flashback during ''[[XY068|Garchomp's Mega Bond!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Cynthia's Gabite}}
In ''[[PS426|Softening Up Kakuna]]'', a Gabite was used by a {{tc|Youngster}} that was challenging the [[Battle Factory (Sinnoh)|Battle Factory]].

In ''[[PS435|The Final Dimensional Duel V]]'', a Gabite appeared on [[Fullmoon Island]] in {{FB|Tower Tycoon|Palmer}}'s flashback.

[[Cynthia's Garchomp]] was seen as a Gabite in ''[[PS460|All About Arceus IX]]''.

[[Benga]]'s Gabite first appeared in [[PS541]].

==Game data==
===NPC appearances===
* [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time, Darkness]] and [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky|Sky]]: Gabite is the boss of the password-exclusive dungeon [[Labyrinth Cave]], as part of a tie-in with the anime special, ''[[SS020|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time & Darkness]]''.
* {{g|Super Mystery Dungeon}}: Another Gabite makes its home in the deepest parts of the [[Drilbur Coal Mine]], and is first boss the player and their partner fight. It guards a horde of valuable gems, which the player and their partner agree to leave alone after hearing its case.

==Trivia==
* Gabite shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Druddigon}}. They are both known as the Cave Pokémon.
* [[Gabite Scale]]s were stated to be a cure for [[Pokémon illness|sickness]] in the anime special ''[[SS020|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time & Darkness]]''.
* Due to [[List of censored words in Pokémon Black and White Versions|the censor]] that prevents Pokémon with offensive [[nickname]]s being traded on the [[GTS]], an English language Gabite cannot be traded on the GTS without a nickname in {{game|Black and White|s}}.

===Origin===
Appearance-wise, Gabite seems like a cross between a {{wp|European dragon}} and a {{wp|shark}}; it may be based on the {{wp|Bulette|landshark}} creature from {{wp|Dungeons & Dragons}}.

====Name origin====
Gabite may be a combination of がぶがぶ ''gabugabu'' (to gobble or gulp down) and ''bite''. It may also derive from がぶりと ''gaburito'' (bite or chew) or がぶりと噛み付く ''gaburitokamitsuku'' (to sink one's teeth into).
